sen.j: 和洋折衷建築（わようせっちゅうけんちく）とは、近代日本において建てられた和風建築と洋風建築の要素を意図的に折衷した建物。
sen.e: Wayo-secchu (Japanese Hybrid Style) architecture refers to a building intentionally blending elements of Japanese style buildings that were built in modern Japanese period and of western buildings.
Wayo-secchu (Japanese Hybrid Style) architecture refers to buildings constructed in modern Japan that intentionally blend elements of Japanese and Western architecture.

sen.e: Wayo-secchu (Japanese Hybrid Style) architecture refers to buildings constructed in modern Japan that intentionally blend elements of Japanese and Western architecture.

sen.j: 幕末の横浜市にルーツを持つと言われ、明治維新後に日本各地で建築された。
sen.e: It is said to be originated in Yokohama City in the end of the Edo period, and they were built in many places of Japan.

sen.e: It has a feature of combination of elements of a western building that was regarded as the civilized one, and of a Japanese building that represented the traditional status.

sen.j: 代表的な建築物としては、1872年に建てられた東京の三井組ハウス（後の第一国立銀行本店）や1876年に建てられた松本市の開智学校、1881年に建てられた札幌市の清華亭などが挙げられる。
sen.e: The representative examples are Mitsui-gumi House (later First National Bank main office) built in 1872, Kaichi Gakko Primary School in Matsumoto City built in 1876, and Seika-tei guest house in Sapporo City in 1881.
